titleStmt.title: Sir Ralph Hoptons and all his forces comming in to the Parliament. on Thursday last, according to the articles and propositions sent to him by Sir Thomas Fairfax, certified in two letters to the Honourable William Lenthall Esquire, Speaker of the Honourable house of Commons. Appointed by the Honourable William Lenthall Esquire Speaker of the Honorable House of Commons, to be forthwith printed and published.
titleStmt.author: Rushworth, John, 1612?-1690.

titleStmt.title: Sir Ralph Hoptons and all his forces comming in to the Parliament. on Thursday last, according to the articles and propositions sent to him by Sir Thomas Fairfax, certified in two letters to the Honourable William Lenthall Esquire, Speaker of the Honourable house of Commons. Appointed by the Honourable William Lenthall Esquire Speaker of the Honorable House of Commons, to be forthwith printed and published.
titleStmt.author: Rushworth, John, 1612?-1690.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Edward Husband, printer to the Honourable House of Commons.,

notesStmt.note: Signed on A4r: J.R., i.e. John Rushworth.
Annotation on Thomason copy: the second 6 in imprint date is crossed out and date altered to 1645.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
